alert.note: Alert for Northern Fairfield; Northern New Haven (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 16 at 7:52AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fairfield and northwestern New Haven Counties through 845 AM EDT... At 752 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Monroe, or near Shelton, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Seymour and Woodbridge around 805 AM EDT. Southbury and Beacon Falls around 815 AM EDT. Naugatuck and Prospect around 820 AM EDT. Middlebury around 825 AM EDT. Cheshire around 830 AM EDT. Waterbury around 835 AM EDT. Wolcott around 840 AM EDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
